properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 8:41AM MST until February 12 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW EXPECTED TODAY...THEN VERY COLD WIND
CHILLS TONIGHT...

.Another clipper system is moving through the Northern Plains
this morning, bringing snow and some blowing snow to the region.
Breezy northwesterly winds will continue to result in some
upslope snow this morning. Periods of light to moderate snow with
areas of blowing snow will continue through the day today, then
diminish by late afternoon into early evening.

Tonight, bitter cold wind chills are expected across south central
South Dakota.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches.

* WHERE...The Northern Foot Hills.

* WHEN...Until 2 PM MST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the
5 1 1 app for your state.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
